p: The leaf essential oil of P. angustifolia from Pù Hoạt Nature Reserve (northern Vietnam) in this study was rich in α-pinene (26.9%), β-pinene (20.8%), spathulenol (5.4%), ( E)-caryophyllene (5.3%), and p-cymene (5.0%), which differs markedly from a previous study on the leaf essential oil from Sao La Nature Reserve (central Vietnam). The previous work reported spathulenol (17.0%), palmitic acid (13.0%), sabinene (6.4%), bicyclogermacrene (5.9%), and artemisia triene (5.1%) to be the major components [ 32]. There is apparently much variation in the volatile components of this plant.
